title: Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board Announces a "Red Sale" on Hundreds of Luxury Red Wines
text:
Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board
HARRISBURG, Pa. , Oct. 9, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- The Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board (PLCB) today announced the details of a luxury red wine sale at all Fine Wine & Good Spirits Premium Collection stores. About 1,800 red wines are currently marked down, up to 60 percent off regularly listed prices.
"This is a fantastic opportunity for consumers to purchase some fantastic wines at great prices," said Dale Horst , director of Marketing and Merchandising. "These reds are only available in limited quantities, though, so if you see something you like, don't wait. Once these products are gone, they're gone."
Some highlights include:
De Trafford Syrah 393 Stellenbosch 2009, was $62.99 , on sale for $40.99 Dominio Pingus Ribera del Duero Psi 2010, was $41.99 , on sale for $33.99 Tamarack Cellars Merlot Columbia Valley 2010, was $24.99 , on sale for $20.99 Villadoria Rosso Langhe DOC 2008, was $14.99 , on sale for $9.99 For the complete list of wines available, visit www.FineWineAndGoodSpirits.com and click "The Red Sale."
Sale products are available in very limited quantities, and only while supplies last.
The PLCB regulates the distribution of beverage alcohol and also operates more than 600 wine and spirits stores statewide. Taxes and store profits are returned to Pennsylvania's General Fund. Since its inception, the PLCB has contributed nearly $14 billion to the Pennsylvania Treasury. For more information about the Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board, visit www.lcb.state.pa.us .
